Name: NORAD Tracks Santa
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask NORAD Tracks Santa, where's Santa?”
“Alexa, ask NORAD Tracks Santa for a fact from the Santa Files.”
“Alexa, ask NORAD Tracks Santa, when will Santa be at my house?”
Skill_description:
Description
A parent or guardian is required to provide permission to use this skill. Amazon will verify you’re an adult via confirmation of your credit card CVV or via text message if you have a phone number on file. Your credit card will not be charged. Once permission is granted, just try saying “Alexa, where’s Santa”.
NORAD Tracks Santa is Santa’s official tracker. On December 24th NORAD conducts a special mission tracking Santa across the globe and keeping him safe. Find out how many days are left until Santa begins his yuletide journey, follow him as he gets ready the day before his flight and hear his location as we track him across the globe on December 24th. You can also get facts from the Top-Secret Santa files. Only Santa knows when he will arrive at your house, but we do know he only arrives when children are asleep.
Find out more about how NORAD tracks Santa at https://noradsanta.org/

Name: Bamboo Books
Skill_description:
Description
Bamboo Books offers narrated stories and exercises to help children improve listening comprehension.
For children using Alexa screen-based devices like Fire tablets and Fire TV, Bamboo Books offers text and images to permit reading along with Alexa. (NOTE: If you are using Fire tablets, make sure to say “Alexa switch to Show Mode.” before saying “Alexa, open Bamboo Books.” so that you can experience all of the text and images.)
Bamboo Books includes selections from classic children’s books & stories such as:
Level 1
• The Little Red Hen by Florence Williams
• Little Red Riding Hood by Unknown Author
• Rumpelstiltzkin by Unknown Author
• The Story of the Three Little Pigs by Unknown Author
• The Story of the Three Bears by Robert Southey
Level 2
• The Story of Doctor Dolittle by Hugh Lofting
• The Elephant's Child by Rudyard Kipling
• The Jungle Book by Rudyard Kipling
• Peter Pan by J. M. Barrie
• The Tale of Peter Rabbit by Beatrix Potter
Level 3
• Alice's Adventures in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll
• Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by Mark Twain
• The Railway Children by Edith Nesbit
• Treasure Island by Robert Louis Stevenson
• The Wonderful Wizard of Oz by L. Frank Baum
Exercises and questions help children practice listening for characters, plot, setting, details, and more.
There are 3 different levels to offer an engaging experience for pre-readers, early, intermediate, and advanced readers. Even adults will enjoy practicing their ability to remember details using only their listening skills.
WE ALSO OFFER A GUIDE TO USING BAMBOO BOOKS AT guide.bamboolearning.com.
Keep checking back periodically for more books!
BENEFITS OF OPTIONAL ACCOUNT LINKING AND BAMBOO GROVE
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Parents can sign up for an optional Bamboo Learning account by going to Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com. Bamboo Grove is where parents can go to follow their children’s progress, including correct and incorrect answers for each book, and badges awarded. After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents will need to link that account with the Bamboo Books Alexa skill. Parents can do this by opening the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com) and then searching for Bamboo Books within the skills section of the Alexa App. After finding Bamboo Books in the Alexa App, select “Settings”, and then “Link Account”. A screen with a Bamboo logo will show up. Sign in to the previously created Bamboo Learning account and Bamboo Books will be linked. After that, visit Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com to view progress.

Name: YouVersion Kids Bible - Daily Story
Skill_description:
Description
YouVersion Kids Bible - Daily Story delivers a different Bible story or video every day to help helps kids and families engage with God's word. 
Kids can play and interact with all of these stories in the Bible App for Kids on iPhone/iPad, Android and Amazon devices. Download the most popular kids Bible app for free at bible.com/kids. 
Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at help@youversion.com.

You can also say "Today's Story" to play the story of the day, or "Play any story" and we'll pick a story to play for you.

Name: Math Facts - Math Practice for Kids
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, tell Math Facts to practice multiplication.”
Skill_description:
Description
Math Facts gives you practice for addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Just open Math Facts, choose your operation, and you'll get a set of five questions.
If you get all five right, expect a silly surprise. This skill makes math practice fun for the whole family!
The skill has been refined through extensive kid testing for accuracy and precision in listening to responses. It's perfect for math practice while you're staying home. Try it out and see the results!

If you need this Christmas a new toy this is a recommended skill to choose the best!

Name: Choose Your Own Adventure
Skill_description:
Description
You decide what happens next in these classic Choose Your Own Adventure® stories brought to you by Audible.
In each professionally narrated story, you are the adventurer who makes the choices that decide your fate.
To help you on your journey:
Say “go back” to go back one scene if you don't like the choice you made.
Say “start over” to start your current story over from the beginning.
Say “change story” if you are ready to switch to another story.
Say "skip" if you want to skip part of the story.
If you need help, just ask.
Stories available from the original series:
*Newly added* Mystery of the Maya by R. A. Montgomery
Space and Beyond by R.A. Montgomery
The Abominable Snowman by R. A. Montgomery
Journey Under the Sea by R. A. Montgomery
Adapted to audiobook by Audible based on original titles © Chooseco LLC.
Features:
40 total endings in Mystery of the Maya
27 total endings in The Magic of the Unicorn
43 total endings in Space and Beyond
28 total endings in The Abominable Snowman
37 total endings in Journey Under the Sea
Progress tracking and automatic bookmarking for resuming later
Choose Your Own Adventure® is compatible with FreeTime devices if you grant permissions to the skill at parents.amazon.com or visit the FreeTime section of the Alexa app.
Issues? Feedback? We want to hear from you. Send us a note: audible-cyoa@audible.com

Name: Short Bedtime Stories

Skill_description:
Description
Welcome to Short Bedtime Stories by Al Summers Media. This skills offers a selection of short bedtime sleep stories.
Want to launch the skill? Just say: "Alexa, open bedtime stories and list all stories" or "Alexa, open bedtime stories and play all stories".
At the moment the skill offers the following bedtime stories: 
1) Tyler meets Santa
2) Joy teaches kindness
3) Danny's ocean adventure
4) Jessica bakes cake
5) Dental heroes
6) Alfi blows bubbles
7) Goldilocks and three bears
8) Little Pirate Joe
9) Cinderella 
10) My Travelling Adventures  (kids decide how the story develops)
11) Halloween Treasure Hunt 
✶✶✶✶✶✶✶✶BRAND NEW✶✶✶✶✶✶✶✶
Play a personalised children's story - ask for example "play personalised story" or "play my personal story". Please be aware that only English names can processed...
NEW FEATURES:
► say "spin the wheel" to play a random bedtime story
► say "Alexa Next" to skip a story
► say"Alexa Repeat" to repeat a story
► say "Alexa Previous" to go back to the previous story
Please leave a rating if you love this skill. Please report bugs via our website. We welcome your feedback!

Name: Animal Game for Kids - Play and Learn
Skill_description:
Description
Probably the best animal sounds game on Amazon Alexa! Play alone, or with friends and family. 
The game is quick. Just five sounds to guess. 
Animal sounds game was created to help children of all ages learn animal sounds while having fun at the same time.
Skill includes most loved animals like dog, cat, sheep, elephant, lion, owl, wolf and even fox. Older girls, boys, and even small toddlers will have a great time! Learn the noises, of pets, farm, and wild animals and birds.
Only real sounds effects, voices, calls and cries of animals.
Do you know animal’s sounds? Do you know what does the fox say? Take this fun challenge now!
Let's Take This Animal Sounds Quiz.
Play and Learn. 
UPDATE: The new updated version of the free Animal Game. Now you can ask Alexa for a hint! Anytime during the animal game, you can say: "give me a hint", or "I don't know" and Alexa will help you.
When it comes to your child, teaching them all of the exciting, funny, and interesting sounds that animals make is one of the most important children’s games to play for their development! Animal sounds help children begin to relate to the world around them and understand the differences between the whole animal kingdom! 
Now for Amazon Alexa, let your child play alone or with friends! Developed for kids of all ages, your child can learn animal sounds and have fun all at the same time. Teach your child how to identify animal sounds from dogs, cats, sheep, elephants, lions, owls, wolves, and even foxes! And trust us, in no time at all, they’ll have every last animal sound down without a hint.

Name: Bedtime Story for Kids

Whether you’re driving with your children or just want to limit your kids’ screen time, Stories Podcast delivers entertainment that kids and parents alike will love.

Name: Jump Ball

Name: Skills for Kids. Tiger Facts
Skill_description:
Description
Tiger Facts is a skill that teaches children wide range of interesting facts about tigers and their cubs.
By default, the skill will play until you stop it. To stop the skill, say "Alexa, stop.” To resume it again, say "Alexa, resume."
Please leave a 5-star review if you love this Skill. Your 5-star reviews will encourage us to keep making more great skills

Name: PayPal
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask PayPal to check my balance”
“Alexa, ask PayPal to send 10 dollars to Sam”
“Alexa, ask PayPal to request 50 dollars from Matt”
Skill_description:
Description
Want to send or request money and get updates within the United States using only your voice? Now you can with the PayPal skill on Alexa. With the PayPal skill, we’re making it easier than ever to check your account updates, including you PayPal balance, and send or request money from friends using nothing more than your voice.
To get started, enable the skill, link your US PayPal account, and select your default way to pay. For added security, you will need to create a 4-digit pin during setup that Alexa will ask for whenever you open the skill.
Once you’ve enabled the skill, simply say “Alexa, Open PayPal.” From there, Alexa can help you send and request money to and from your top PayPal contacts in the US, as well as gives account updates and check your balance. Try saying the following commands:
 “updates please”
 “Send Money”
 “Send 10 dollars to David”
 “Receive 20 dollars”
 “What is new in my account?”
 “is there any update in my account?”
 "What’s the status of my dispute"
 "What happened to my refund request"
 “What’s my balance?”
 
You can also try by saying the full command, such as “Alexa, ask PayPal to Send $5 to Sam.”
To make the skill more useful, you’ll need to either send or request money to your PayPal contacts, or you can easily import contacts by visiting https://www.paypal.com/skills/setting. 
Note: For now, PayPal's Alexa skill is only available in the United States. We waive all fees when you send money domestically using your PayPal balance or bank account. Standard fees apply when sending using debit or credit cards.
Disclaimer: Please be aware that the skill will read out the financial information (Ex: PayPal balance) loud.
For more information about the PayPal skill, visit https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/amazon-echo-and-alexa

Name: Amex
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask Amex to make a payment”
“Alexa, ask Amex for my Amex Offers”
Skill_description:
Description
Explore a new way to connect with American Express through the Amex skill. Make a payment, get Amex Offers, check your balance, and more - all with the power of your voice.
Just say, "Alexa, open Amex." Once you've opened the skill, here are some voice commands that you can use to manage eligible U.S. Cards in your American Express online account:
To check your account balance, say "Account balance"
To make a payment, say "Make a payment"
To get Amex Offers, say "Amex Offers"
To review recent charges, say "Recent charges"
To hear payment due date, say "Payment due date"
To check available credit, say "Available credit"
To check Membership Rewards® balance, say "Membership Rewards"
To get started, simply enable the skill and link your American Express online account.  As an extra layer of security, you will create a 4-digit PIN.
For more information about the Amex skill and eligible U.S. Cards, visit americanexpress.com/alexa.

Name: Store Card
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask store card what is my account balance?”
“Alexa, ask store card to make a payment.”
Skill_description:
Description
A new way to manage your Amazon.com Store Card or the Amazon Prime Store Card by simply using your voice. You can use this skill to make a payment for your Amazon Store Card. You can also check your account balance, get details about your due payment, hear recent purchases and much more.  
START MANAGING YOUR ACCOUNT THE SIMPLE WAY.
Download the Amazon Alexa app and follow three simple steps to start managing your Amazon Store Card account with the power of your voice.
1.	Go to “Skills” in the Alexa app. Browse or search for Store Card. Select "Enable" and accept the "Terms and Conditions". 
2.	Enter your Amazon Store Card username and password. Create a Voice Key. 
3.	Get started by talking to Alexa about your Amazon Store Card account by saying “Alexa, open Store Card". 
WHAT YOU CAN ASK ALEXA TO DO FOR YOU 
Say “Alexa, open Store Card” to manage your account and then you can do any of the following:
•	Make a payment 
•	Check when your balance is due and choose how much to pay.
•	Review your recent transactions
•	Get details about your last purchases and charges.
•	Check your account information
•	Ask for your account summary, last payment, due date and more.
JUST ASK STORE CARD. IT’S EASY.
First say, "Alexa, open Store Card" and then try saying,
•	"I want to pay my credit card bill."
•	"Did my payment go through"
•	"When is my payment due"
•	"What is my minimum payment"
•	"What did I recently buy"
•	"What did I last buy"
•	"How much money have I spent lately"
•	"What is my recent activity"
•	"What is my account summary"
•	"How much available credit do I have"
•	"What were my previous charges"
•	"I need help”
When using the Store Card Skill, your Alexa-enabled device may communicate account information aloud and/or visually based on prompts by you.

Name: Capital One
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask Capital One what's my account balance?”
“Alexa, ask Capital One to make a credit card payment.”
Skill_description:
Description
Ask Capital One about your credit card, checking, savings, and auto loan accounts. Then try out our new feature, "How much did I spend?" to get quick answers on how much and where you are spending. 
Once you’ve enabled the skill, say “Alexa ask Capital One…”
For your credit card:
· “How much did I spend at Target last month?” 
· “How much did I spend at Starbucks last weekend?”
· “What’s my current credit card balance?”
· “When is my credit card bill due?”
· “To pay my credit card bill.”
For your bank accounts:
· “What’s my checking account balance?”
· “What are my recent transactions?”
For your auto loan:
· “What’s my car loan principal balance?” 
· “What's my payoff quote?”
· “When is my car loan due?”
· “To pay my car loan bill.” 
To get started, sign in with your Capital One username and password (which we keep completely private).  You can also create a personal key for extra security. 
 
We're always learning and building new features, but we can't do that well without your feedback.  If you have comments, please share them with us at www.CapitalOne.com/Alexa.

Name: Phone.com Audio Interface
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa tell phone com to ring John Smith”
Skill_description:
Description
Use Alexa to make calls with your Phone.com account!   You will need a Phone.com account and either a softphone or desk phone connected to your account.
When you tell Alexa to make a call, your softphone or IP phone will ring, and once you answer, your call will be placed to whomever it is you want to call, whether you say a name from your Phone.com address book or a specific phone number.  
There’s no longer any need to use your keypad, just your Alexa-powered device!

Name: Social Launch Media
Skill_description:
Description
Our Social Launch Briefing offers you short, convenient, yet actionable ideas daily as we share the latest social media and voice strategies. These best practices are specific to the real estate and coaching industries.
Let a couple of minutes spent with us daily increase your sales in 2019.

Name: Create My Voice
Skill_description:
Description
The team at Create My Voice build Custom Alexa Skills for you, using your brand, for your audience.   This Custom Alexa Skill demonstrates how people can listen to a BLOG (instead of reading it).  Now you can be cooking breakfast, working out, or even commuting and you can listen to the Create My Voice BLOG posts.  The Create My Voice BLOG posts are meant to demonstrate how you could engage your audience with your own Custom Alexa Skill.  Amazon continues to lead the industry with Text-to-Speech capabilities.  You can hear some of them just by asking "Alexa, Ask Create My Voice to read post number 32" and "Alexa, Ask Create My Voice to read post number 27".  
You can find out more about how the team at Create My Voice can create a Custom Alexa Skill for you at www.CreateMyVoice.com.  
But to listen to the Create My Voice BLOG and to hear more about voice-first technology, try the following:
Engage the skill by saying:
  Alexa, Start Create My Voice
Once the skill is engaged, try the following commands:
  Read the latest blog post
  Find Smart Speaker
  Search for Elderly
  Tell me about Create My Voice
  Tell me about the owners
  Help
**For information about this Alexa skill, visit www.CreateMyVoice.com or send an email to Support@CreateMyVoice.com

Name: CNBC
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask CNBC When is the next earnings date for Comcast”
“Alexa, ask CNBC how are the markets doing.”
“Alexa, ask CNBC for the price of Comcast”
Skill_description:
Description
With the CNBC skill, get the latest business news, real-time financial information, and market data. Ask for the market data you care about for stocks, commodities, indexes and more. Track investments throughout the day with additional support for pre-markets & extended hours quotes. Listen to a LIVE audio stream of CNBC programming, exclusive audio-only business news updates, or get caught up on the latest CNBC podcast.
Try saying things like:
“Alexa, ask CNBC what Comcast is trading at” to get a quote for stocks, ETFs, or commodities
“Alexa, ask CNBC for advanced market data” to learn more about the 20+ datapoints that we support.
“Alexa, ask CNBC how are the markets doing” to check on the Dow, Nasdaq, and S&P 500.
“Alexa, ask CNBC for the latest news” to hear the latest business headlines.
“Alexa, ask CNBC for the live audio stream” to hear LIVE CNBC programming.
“Alexa, ask CNBC to play the Mad Money podcast” to hear the latest episode of your favorite CNBC podcast.
We’re constantly updating and improving the CNBC skill’s functionality. Have a comment, suggestion, or question? Reach out to us at customercare@cnbc.com

Name: YNAB
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask Why Nab for the balance of Groceries”
“Alexa, tell Why Nab to record a new transaction for 9 dollars”
Skill_description:
Description
Have Alexa help you gain total control of your money! The YNAB Alexa Skill makes checking a category balance or recording new spending a breeze!
Never heard of YNAB? (Alexa pronounces it "Why Nab" and you should too.) It stands for You Need A Budget. It’s a powerful methodology coupled with award-winning software on the web, mobile, and now this companion Alexa Skill.
This is a companion skill for YNAB. It requires that you first set things up with YNAB at YouNeedABudget.com. Once you have have a YNAB account, have enabled the skill and linked your YNAB account, you are ready to budget like a pro.
To check a category balance:
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab What’s the balance of Transportation?”
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab for the balance of Eating Out”
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab are we able to spend any money on Gifts?”
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab how much cash do we have available to spend in our Gas category?”
To record new spending:
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab to record a new transaction.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab to log 25 dollars and 64 cents in Eating Out from Checking.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab I just spent 9 dollars and 32 cents.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab I just received 10 bucks.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab I received 5 dollars yesterday.”
At any time you can say:
· "I'm done"
· "Help"
· "Start over"
· "Quit"
To get started, we'll ask you to securely sign in with your YNAB email and password and select a budget for Alexa to access. You can revoke this access at any time from the "My Account" page.
Disclaimer: This skill may not be suitable for all ages so parental discretion is advised.

Name: U.S. Bank
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask U.S. Bank to get my checking account balance.”
“Alexa, ask U.S. Bank to get my credit card transactions.”
“Alexa, ask U.S. Bank to make a payment.”
Skill_description:
Description
Conduct simple, everyday banking tasks for your U.S. Bank checking, savings or credit card accounts with help from Alexa.
Once you’ve enabled the skill, follow the simple instructions to link your account, provided within the Alexa companion app. Securely log in with your online banking username and password, then create a unique four-digit security code, which you’ll be prompted for each time you invoke the U.S. Bank skill.  
After linking your account, say ‘Alexa, open U.S. Bank…’ Once you’ve been authenticated, you can:
Ask for account balance information:
“Alexa, ask U.S. Bank what’s my checking account balance?”
“Alexa, ask U.S. Bank how much do I owe on my credit card?”
Ask for recent transactions:
“Alexa, ask U.S. Bank what are the most recent transactions on my credit card?”
“Alexa, ask U.S. Bank to give me more details on my checking account transactions.”
Ask for due dates:
“Alexa, ask U.S. Bank when is my next credit card bill due?”
Pay your credit card bill:
“Alexa, make a payment.”

Name: LifeLock™
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask Lifelock to read my alerts”
“Alexa, ask Lifelock to get data breach articles”
Skill_description:
Description
Introducing the LifeLock skill for Amazon Alexa!
Retrieve your LifeLock alerts, find out your credit score, know your plan details and much more*. Simply enable the LifeLock skill, link your LifeLock member account and ask away!
LifeLock membership is required to use most features of this skill. If you don’t have a LifeLock account, please visit www.lifelock.com to enroll in a LifeLock membership.
*Note: The features available to you in the LifeLock skill depend upon the type of LifeLock membership you have. To upgrade your membership, please visit www.lifelock.com/#planschart
After you have successfully enabled the LifeLock skill and linked your member account, simply say “Alexa, Open LifeLock" and ask away:
“Read my alerts” - This will retrieve all your unhandled alerts and notifications. You can try other variations of this phrase like “Read my alerts from yesterday”
“Get my transactions” - This feature will read the latest financial transactions from your connected accounts. You can also ask "Get my transactions since last month" or "Get my transactions from January"
“What is my Credit Score” – Need to know your latest credit score? Say this phrase and LifeLock will get your latest Vantage Score from Equifax. 
“Get news based on my transactions” - This unique and innovative feature will find new articles about identity theft relevant to your transactions. (requires LifeLock Advantage or LifeLock Ultimate Plus membership)
For more questions around LifeLock, please visit https://memberportal.lifelock.com/support
*Disclaimer: For all features in the LifeLock skill, any usage of financial information will always be read out loud.

Name: PayPal
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask PayPal to check my balance”
“Alexa, ask PayPal to send 10 dollars to Sam”
“Alexa, ask PayPal to request 50 dollars from Matt”
Skill_description:
Description
Want to send or request money and get updates within the United States using only your voice? Now you can with the PayPal skill on Alexa. With the PayPal skill, we’re making it easier than ever to check your account updates, including you PayPal balance, and send or request money from friends using nothing more than your voice.
To get started, enable the skill, link your US PayPal account, and select your default way to pay. For added security, you will need to create a 4-digit pin during setup that Alexa will ask for whenever you open the skill.
Once you’ve enabled the skill, simply say “Alexa, Open PayPal.” From there, Alexa can help you send and request money to and from your top PayPal contacts in the US, as well as gives account updates and check your balance. Try saying the following commands:
 “updates please”
 “Send Money”
 “Send 10 dollars to David”
 “Receive 20 dollars”
 “What is new in my account?”
 “is there any update in my account?”
 "What’s the status of my dispute"
 "What happened to my refund request"
 “What’s my balance?”
 
You can also try by saying the full command, such as “Alexa, ask PayPal to Send $5 to Sam.”
To make the skill more useful, you’ll need to either send or request money to your PayPal contacts, or you can easily import contacts by visiting https://www.paypal.com/skills/setting. 
Note: For now, PayPal's Alexa skill is only available in the United States. We waive all fees when you send money domestically using your PayPal balance or bank account. Standard fees apply when sending using debit or credit cards.
Disclaimer: Please be aware that the skill will read out the financial information (Ex: PayPal balance) loud.
For more information about the PayPal skill, visit https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/amazon-echo-and-alexa

Name: Amex
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask Amex to make a payment”
“Alexa, ask Amex for my Amex Offers”
Skill_description:
Description
Explore a new way to connect with American Express through the Amex skill. Make a payment, get Amex Offers, check your balance, and more - all with the power of your voice.
Just say, "Alexa, open Amex." Once you've opened the skill, here are some voice commands that you can use to manage eligible U.S. Cards in your American Express online account:
To check your account balance, say "Account balance"
To make a payment, say "Make a payment"
To get Amex Offers, say "Amex Offers"
To review recent charges, say "Recent charges"
To hear payment due date, say "Payment due date"
To check available credit, say "Available credit"
To check Membership Rewards® balance, say "Membership Rewards"
To get started, simply enable the skill and link your American Express online account.  As an extra layer of security, you will create a 4-digit PIN.
For more information about the Amex skill and eligible U.S. Cards, visit americanexpress.com/alexa.

Name: Store Card
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask store card what is my account balance?”
“Alexa, ask store card to make a payment.”
Skill_description:
Description
A new way to manage your Amazon.com Store Card or the Amazon Prime Store Card by simply using your voice. You can use this skill to make a payment for your Amazon Store Card. You can also check your account balance, get details about your due payment, hear recent purchases and much more.  
START MANAGING YOUR ACCOUNT THE SIMPLE WAY.
Download the Amazon Alexa app and follow three simple steps to start managing your Amazon Store Card account with the power of your voice.
1.	Go to “Skills” in the Alexa app. Browse or search for Store Card. Select "Enable" and accept the "Terms and Conditions". 
2.	Enter your Amazon Store Card username and password. Create a Voice Key. 
3.	Get started by talking to Alexa about your Amazon Store Card account by saying “Alexa, open Store Card". 
WHAT YOU CAN ASK ALEXA TO DO FOR YOU 
Say “Alexa, open Store Card” to manage your account and then you can do any of the following:
•	Make a payment 
•	Check when your balance is due and choose how much to pay.
•	Review your recent transactions
•	Get details about your last purchases and charges.
•	Check your account information
•	Ask for your account summary, last payment, due date and more.
JUST ASK STORE CARD. IT’S EASY.
First say, "Alexa, open Store Card" and then try saying,
•	"I want to pay my credit card bill."
•	"Did my payment go through"
•	"When is my payment due"
•	"What is my minimum payment"
•	"What did I recently buy"
•	"What did I last buy"
•	"How much money have I spent lately"
•	"What is my recent activity"
•	"What is my account summary"
•	"How much available credit do I have"
•	"What were my previous charges"
•	"I need help”
When using the Store Card Skill, your Alexa-enabled device may communicate account information aloud and/or visually based on prompts by you.

Name: Capital One
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask Capital One what's my account balance?”
“Alexa, ask Capital One to make a credit card payment.”
Skill_description:
Description
Ask Capital One about your credit card, checking, savings, and auto loan accounts. Then try out our new feature, "How much did I spend?" to get quick answers on how much and where you are spending. 
Once you’ve enabled the skill, say “Alexa ask Capital One…”
For your credit card:
· “How much did I spend at Target last month?” 
· “How much did I spend at Starbucks last weekend?”
· “What’s my current credit card balance?”
· “When is my credit card bill due?”
· “To pay my credit card bill.”
For your bank accounts:
· “What’s my checking account balance?”
· “What are my recent transactions?”
For your auto loan:
· “What’s my car loan principal balance?” 
· “What's my payoff quote?”
· “When is my car loan due?”
· “To pay my car loan bill.” 
To get started, sign in with your Capital One username and password (which we keep completely private).  You can also create a personal key for extra security. 
 
We're always learning and building new features, but we can't do that well without your feedback.  If you have comments, please share them with us at www.CapitalOne.com/Alexa.

Name: Phone.com Audio Interface
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa tell phone com to ring John Smith”
Skill_description:
Description
Use Alexa to make calls with your Phone.com account!   You will need a Phone.com account and either a softphone or desk phone connected to your account.
When you tell Alexa to make a call, your softphone or IP phone will ring, and once you answer, your call will be placed to whomever it is you want to call, whether you say a name from your Phone.com address book or a specific phone number.  
There’s no longer any need to use your keypad, just your Alexa-powered device!

Name: Social Launch Media
Skill_description:
Description
Our Social Launch Briefing offers you short, convenient, yet actionable ideas daily as we share the latest social media and voice strategies. These best practices are specific to the real estate and coaching industries.
Let a couple of minutes spent with us daily increase your sales in 2019.

Name: Create My Voice
Skill_description:
Description
The team at Create My Voice build Custom Alexa Skills for you, using your brand, for your audience.   This Custom Alexa Skill demonstrates how people can listen to a BLOG (instead of reading it).  Now you can be cooking breakfast, working out, or even commuting and you can listen to the Create My Voice BLOG posts.  The Create My Voice BLOG posts are meant to demonstrate how you could engage your audience with your own Custom Alexa Skill.  Amazon continues to lead the industry with Text-to-Speech capabilities.  You can hear some of them just by asking "Alexa, Ask Create My Voice to read post number 32" and "Alexa, Ask Create My Voice to read post number 27".  
You can find out more about how the team at Create My Voice can create a Custom Alexa Skill for you at www.CreateMyVoice.com.  
But to listen to the Create My Voice BLOG and to hear more about voice-first technology, try the following:
Engage the skill by saying:
  Alexa, Start Create My Voice
Once the skill is engaged, try the following commands:
  Read the latest blog post
  Find Smart Speaker
  Search for Elderly
  Tell me about Create My Voice
  Tell me about the owners
  Help
**For information about this Alexa skill, visit www.CreateMyVoice.com or send an email to Support@CreateMyVoice.com

Name: CNBC
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask CNBC When is the next earnings date for Comcast”
“Alexa, ask CNBC how are the markets doing.”
“Alexa, ask CNBC for the price of Comcast”
Skill_description:
Description
With the CNBC skill, get the latest business news, real-time financial information, and market data. Ask for the market data you care about for stocks, commodities, indexes and more. Track investments throughout the day with additional support for pre-markets & extended hours quotes. Listen to a LIVE audio stream of CNBC programming, exclusive audio-only business news updates, or get caught up on the latest CNBC podcast.
Try saying things like:
“Alexa, ask CNBC what Comcast is trading at” to get a quote for stocks, ETFs, or commodities
“Alexa, ask CNBC for advanced market data” to learn more about the 20+ datapoints that we support.
“Alexa, ask CNBC how are the markets doing” to check on the Dow, Nasdaq, and S&P 500.
“Alexa, ask CNBC for the latest news” to hear the latest business headlines.
“Alexa, ask CNBC for the live audio stream” to hear LIVE CNBC programming.
“Alexa, ask CNBC to play the Mad Money podcast” to hear the latest episode of your favorite CNBC podcast.
We’re constantly updating and improving the CNBC skill’s functionality. Have a comment, suggestion, or question? Reach out to us at customercare@cnbc.com

Name: YNAB
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask Why Nab for the balance of Groceries”
“Alexa, tell Why Nab to record a new transaction for 9 dollars”
Skill_description:
Description
Have Alexa help you gain total control of your money! The YNAB Alexa Skill makes checking a category balance or recording new spending a breeze!
Never heard of YNAB? (Alexa pronounces it "Why Nab" and you should too.) It stands for You Need A Budget. It’s a powerful methodology coupled with award-winning software on the web, mobile, and now this companion Alexa Skill.
This is a companion skill for YNAB. It requires that you first set things up with YNAB at YouNeedABudget.com. Once you have have a YNAB account, have enabled the skill and linked your YNAB account, you are ready to budget like a pro.
To check a category balance:
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab What’s the balance of Transportation?”
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab for the balance of Eating Out”
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab are we able to spend any money on Gifts?”
· “Alexa, ask Why Nab how much cash do we have available to spend in our Gas category?”
To record new spending:
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab to record a new transaction.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab to log 25 dollars and 64 cents in Eating Out from Checking.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab I just spent 9 dollars and 32 cents.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab I just received 10 bucks.”
· “Alexa, tell Why Nab I received 5 dollars yesterday.”
At any time you can say:
· "I'm done"
· "Help"
· "Start over"
· "Quit"
To get started, we'll ask you to securely sign in with your YNAB email and password and select a budget for Alexa to access. You can revoke this access at any time from the "My Account" page.
Disclaimer: This skill may not be suitable for all ages so parental discretion is advised.

Name: PayPal
Sample_Invocation_Utterances: “Alexa, ask PayPal to check my balance”
“Alexa, ask PayPal to send 10 dollars to Sam”
“Alexa, ask PayPal to request 50 dollars from Matt”
Skill_description:
Description
Want to send or request money and get updates within the United States using only your voice? Now you can with the PayPal skill on Alexa. With the PayPal skill, we’re making it easier than ever to check your account updates, including you PayPal balance, and send or request money from friends using nothing more than your voice.
To get started, enable the skill, link your US PayPal account, and select your default way to pay. For added security, you will need to create a 4-digit pin during setup that Alexa will ask for whenever you open the skill.
Once you’ve enabled the skill, simply say “Alexa, Open PayPal.” From there, Alexa can help you send and request money to and from your top PayPal contacts in the US, as well as gives account updates and check your balance. Try saying the following commands:
 “updates please”
 “Send Money”
 “Send 10 dollars to David”
 “Receive 20 dollars”
 “What is new in my account?”
 “is there any update in my account?”
 "What’s the status of my dispute"
 "What happened to my refund request"
 “What’s my balance?”
 
You can also try by saying the full command, such as “Alexa, ask PayPal to Send $5 to Sam.”
To make the skill more useful, you’ll need to either send or request money to your PayPal contacts, or you can easily import contacts by visiting https://www.paypal.com/skills/setting. 
Note: For now, PayPal's Alexa skill is only available in the United States. We waive all fees when you send money domestically using your PayPal balance or bank account. Standard fees apply when sending using debit or credit cards.
Disclaimer: Please be aware that the skill will read out the financial information (Ex: PayPal balance) loud.
For more information about the PayPal skill, visit https://www.paypal.com/us/webapps/mpp/amazon-echo-and-alexa
